Merge pull request #197 from tra38/links

Display links using markdown syntax
Rename _get_text to get_text

Fix bug where copy in links is not correctly gathered

The code previously assumed that the copy of the hyperlink is within
the 'a' tag, but it is possible that the copy may be nested within
another div, like a ```code``` tag. Therefore, we would return None
for the copy, even if there was some copy avaliable to display
to the user.

We fix this issue by wrapping the whole hyperlink as a "pquery object"
and then extracting the text from that object.

I also did some additional refactoring of the code as well,
since we no longer need to initialize a "pquery object" after
gathering the copy and href...since we need to initialize a
"pquery object" anyway to gather the copy.
Refactor _add_links_to_text

Merge pull request #195 from tra38/homebrew_issue

Update pyquery dependency

Merge pull request #196 from tra38/remove_unnecessary_test

Remove unnecessary test code that supported Python 2.6

Replace all usage of ’ with '

In Python 2.7, we are receiving this error:

"SyntaxError: Non-ASCII character '\xe2' in file test_howdoi.py
on line 113, but no encoding declared; see http://python.org/dev/peps/pep-0263/
for details"

It appears that ’ is a non-ASCII character, so to ensure that this
test works fine on Python 2.7, I replaced it with a proper ASCII character:
'.

Display no link-associated markdown if the copy duplicates the href

Sometimes a user may paste a URL directly into an answer
and Stack Overflow formats that URL as a valid hyperlink.
This means that if we try to convert every hyperlink
into markdown, we will get output like
[https://example.com](https://example.com), which is repetitive
and useless.

Therefore, before we do any replacement, we check if the href
and the copy are equal to each other. If they are, then we don't
provide a Markdown version of the hyperlink. Instead, we simply
use the plain text version.

Display links using markdown syntax

Some answers on the StackExchange network include hyperlinks
to other content on the Internet. Ideally, those hyperlinks would serve
as "supplemental" reading, but there has been instances where the hyperlink
contains most of the answer (the so-called "link-only answers").

howdoi currently ignores all hyperlinks within the answer of the
question, preferring instead to display a raw-text version of the answer.
While this is suitable for most instances, there are a few cases
where you may want to dig deeper and follow those hyperlinks, especially
if you have encountered a "link-only answer". Rather than viewing the
StackExchange answer through the browser and risk distraction,
it would be preferable to see the hyperlinks directly in the terminal.

Remove unnecessary test code that supported Python 2.6

When writing automated tests for #177, I learned that
Python 2.6 did not have support for assertSequenceEqual. To ensure
that the automated tests could run on Python 2.6, I wrote some
additional code.

However, in #186, we dropped support for Python 2.6. Therefore,
we no longer need this code. Removing it would help simplify
the test code and make it easier to maintain.

Add "Answer From" to the Answer Header

Older versions of howdoi showed this text at
the bottom of every answer whenever you use the --all
parmaeter. When I made my change, I accidentally removed
the "Answer From" text, necessiating me to add it back in,
but this time at the *top* of every answer.
Update automated test to take into account changes

Add URLs by default

According to Issue #152, answers from StackOverflow requires
attribution. This commit provides this attribution in the form
of links.

This commit uses code from https://github.com/gleitz/howdoi/pull/153
as a starting point, but then incorporates the suggestion by GabLeRoux
to use special characters to separate the hyperlink from the answer.
